Leverage proxy: loan amount vs. income. Higher values imply higher repayment burden.
Debt service ratio proxy: annualized annuity vs. income; captures affordability.
Loan-to-price ratio: loan amount vs. goods price; high values can be risk signal.
Age in years. Risk can be non-linear across ages; important control variable.
Tenure in years. Longer employment often implies income stability and lower risk.
Employment proportion over lifespan; age-adjusted employment stability.
